title: #IOConnectivityLoSCapabilities.IOConnectivityLoSCapabilities

enumDescriptions.SMBAndNFS: Both SMB and an NFS protocol

enumLongDescriptions.FC: This enumeration literal shall indicate the Fibre Channel Framing and Signaling Interface.
enumLongDescriptions.FCP: This enumeration literal shall indicate the Fibre Channel SCSI Protocol.
enumLongDescriptions.iSCSI: This enumeration literal shall indicate the Internet SCSI protocol.
enumLongDescriptions.SAS: This enumeration literal shall indicate the Serial Attached SCSI protocol.
enumLongDescriptions.SMB: This enumeration literal shall indicate the SMB protocol.
enumLongDescriptions.NFSv3: This enumeration literal shall indicate the NFSv3 protocol.
enumLongDescriptions.NFSv4: This enumeration literal shall indicate the NFSv4 protocol.
enumLongDescriptions.HTTP: This enumeration literal shall indicate the Hypertext Transfer Protocol.
enumLongDescriptions.HTTPS: This enumeration literal shall indicate the Secure HTTP protocol.
enumLongDescriptions.FTP: This enumeration literal shall indicate the File Transfer Protocol.
enumLongDescriptions.FTPS: This enumeration literal shall indicate the Secure FTP protocol.
enumLongDescriptions.SecureNFS: This enumeration literal shall indicate the Secure NFS protocol.
enumLongDescriptions.FICON: This enumeration literal shall indicate the FICON protocol.
enumLongDescriptions.FCOE: This enumeration literal shall indicate the FC2 over Ethernet protocol.
enumLongDescriptions.SMBAndNFS: This enumeration literal shall indicate that both SMB and an NFS protocol are supported.

AccessProtocol.description: This enumeration defines choices for access protocols.
AccessProtocol.longDescription: This enumeration may be used to specify an access protocol.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

AccessProtocol.longDescription: The Enumeration Literal shall specify the Access protocol for this service option. NOTE: If SMB+NFS* is specified, the corresponding MaxSupportedIOPS governs the max achieved across both protocol uses. This may be less than the sum of the individual max values.

MaxIOPS.description: The maximum supported IOs per second that the connection will support for the selected access protocol.
MaxIOPS.longDescription: The value shall be the maximum IOs per second that the connection shall allow for the selected access protocol.

IOConnectivityLineOfService.description: A service option within the IO Connectivity line of service.
IOConnectivityLineOfService.longDescription: An IO connectivity service option may be used to specify the characteristics of storage connectivity.
